description: A phishing email targeting employees to steal login credentials. No sensitive data was accessed.
A botnet attack is intermittently affecting website load times. It hasn't caused major service disruptions.
An internal misconfiguration in the firewall exposed non-critical server logs. No data breach occurred.

An anonymous hacker using the alias 'Buster Ping' has targeted the company’s internal systems. The attacker left behind a calling card, a cryptic message, which led to a personal website: <a href="/busterping.html
Malware was found in an email attachment opened by a low-level employee. Systems were isolated and cleaned.
Multiple failed login attempts were detected on the admin portal. Account lockouts and password changes were initiated.
Suspicious employee activity within internal systems. No data was accessed yet, but investigation ongoing.
A third-party breach exposed a list of reused passwords. Affected users were prompted to change passwords.
A website defacement occurred. The attacker replaced the homepage with a message, but no data was stolen.
An exploit in outdated software allowed unauthorized access to a non-sensitive internal network. Patches have been applied.
A USB drive containing malware was accidentally plugged into the company network. The device was isolated and malware was removed.
An unauthorized software application was found installed on a workstation. It was removed and the user warned.
Suspicious DDoS attack detected. Multiple IPs are flooding the company’s servers. Affected services are being mitigated.
Unauthorized access to backup servers was detected. Only non-critical backup data was compromised.
An attempted VPN breach by a threat actor was detected. No successful connections were made, but monitoring continues.
